page.title: 01Rhe Dale, Rievaulx Parish
page.content: This area is within the North York Moors National Park. It comprises mainly conferous forest, owned by the Forestry Commission, mixed woodland and mixed arable land. There are no villages but many individual farmhouses all still achively farming the land. There are is very flat, a plateau with several wooded valleys cut into it. These are only 3 roads crossing the area and many footpaths enabling walkers to reach the more attractive parts. Farming is intensive here with crops growing both in the winter and summer; there are no significant physical restrants to farming or communication. The River Rye runs across the western edge of this area.
